str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Foreign, alien, subst: a foreigner, sojourner. From para and oikos; having a home near, i.e. a by-dweller.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From allos; another's, i.e. Not one's own; by extension foreign, not akin, hostile.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To enslave. From doulos; to enslave.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To treat badly, afflict, embitter, make angry. From kakos; to injure; figuratively, to exasperate.
Four hundred. Plural from tessares and hekaton; four hundred.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.
